sponsor.partnerMessage: Incfile makes incorporating a company easy, so you can focus on the important things. Beyond free LLC filing, Incfile has a full suite of startup services (like banking and bookkeeping), which means Incfile not only helps you get started, but supports you in your continued success as your one-stop shop. Get started now!

posts.title: Arkansas Track Teams Sweep SEC Indoor Championship
posts.content:
Arkansas Track & Field showed off its speed over the weekend during the SEC Indoor Championship, with both men’s and women’s teams taking home the titles — the 10th time Arkansas has swept team titles at the SEC Indoor Championships. 

  • Gals: The No. 2 women’s team attained its 9th consecutive title, punctuating Lance Harter’s final year as head coach with victory and pushing Arkansas ahead of LSU for the most SEC Indoor titles at 13. 
  • Guys: The top-ranked men’s team secured its 4th consecutive SEC Indoor title, asserting the program’s dominance in the sport with 26 wins out of the meet’s 32 occurrences. 

Read more about the meet HERE.

posts.title: Duwendé To Kick Off VoiceJam Festival At Walton Arts Center
posts.content:
Six a cappella groups from across the US will compete at Walton Arts Center on Apr 15 for the title of VoiceJam Champion.

  • Perfect pitch: The finalists VIBE, Walk the Line, Trillium, A-Side, Mind The Gap, and Euphoria will perform on Apr 15 for an expert panel of judges who will score them on vocal percussion, arrangement, soloists, and choreography.
  • Funkytown: The night before the competition, Apr 14, the a capella sensation Duwendé will kick off the VoiceJam Festival with their classic bass-and-beatbox-driven funk/pop style.

Learn more about VoiceJam Festival and reserve tickets HERE.

posts.title: 33rd Annual NWA Home Show Returns To Springdale This Weekend
posts.content:
The 33rd Annual NWA Home Show is coming to Springdale on Mar 3-5, gathering over 100 experts and vendors to provide practical services and advice from home building to remodeling to energy efficiency.

  • Join in: The NWA Home Builders Foundation, which trains, educates, and employs future construction and skilled labor, will be present for those interested in entering the building and construction industry.
  • For everyone: Whether you are a homeowner looking to start a remodel, want to get into landscaping, or are in the market for your first home, there's something for everyone. Not to mention food trucks, prizes, and more!

Find a list of vendors and buy tickets for just $6 HERE.

posts.title: Fayetteville Earns “Tree City USA” Designation For 28th Year
posts.content:
The Arbor Day Foundation has named Fayetteville a Tree City USA for the 28th year in a row, recognizing the city's commitment to urban forest management. 

  • Tree-mendous work: The tall requirements for the award include having a tree board, a tree care ordinance, a minimum annual forestry budget of $2 per capita, and holding an annual Arbor Day observance, which Fayetteville celebrates each October by giving away thousands of trees. 
  • Counting the rings: Fayetteville isn't the only Northwest Arkansas city with a green thumb. Eureka Springs has earned the Tree City USA for an impressive 40 years running.

Find more Tree City USA stats for Arkansas HERE.

posts.title: Chuy's Fayetteville Hosts Grand Opening Today
posts.content:
Clear your lunch break… actually, take the whole afternoon off. Chuy’s Fayetteville opens today at 11a. 

  • New hot spot: Chuy’s Fayetteville is located at 642 E. Millsap Rd and will be open seven days a week from 11a to 9p, Sunday through Thursday, and until 10p on Fridays and Saturdays.
  • The king: The eclectic Tex-Mex destination specializes in one-of-a-kind dishes made with hand-rolled tortillas. Check out the Chicka Chicka Boom Boom enchiladas or the Elvis Green Chile Fried Chicken… and good luck not overdoing it on the creamy jalapeño dip. 

Follow along for more updates HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Sequoyah's centennial: Fayetteville will ring the bells at 2:22p on Mar 15 to celebrate 100 years of the Mount Sequoyah retreat center! Join the party on the mountain to learn more about the historic site's bright future.*
  • Bullseye: Springdale's Knapp Elementary 5th Grade Archery Team has qualified for state and is setting their aim to win the championship.
  • Ready to roll: True to its name, Uncommon Egg Rolls food truck, located outside Fossil Cove Brewery, serves up eccentrically delicious egg roll flavors like reuben, chicken fajita, and Philly cheesesteak, plus dessert egg rolls and waffle fries!
